last_message.message: I think you are sleeping now so I will say good morning to you. Have a lovely day and take care

messages.message: Good morning from Sweden and good afternoon to you! I am 67 years old (young). I think you might think I am too old for you. I am taking care of the house and I am building a house for the things I have to take care of the land. My place is a bit larger than 2 hectares. I exercise and go out with the boat or canoe when the weather is good. I spend time with my daughter and her family. Visiting friends and soo.
How about you? What do you like?
I wish you a great day and take care

Good evening from Bali! ‚òÄÔ∏è Your life by the lake sounds absolutely dreamy, canoeing and spending time with family sounds like such a beautiful way to live. At 67, you seem so active and full of life! Age is just a number when the connection feels right. I'm actually really drawn to mature partners who have that kind of stability and wisdom. Right now I'm juggling university studies with my village social project here in Bali, lots of beach walks, sketching designs, and sneaking in spicy food challenges when I can! What's your favorite way to relax after a day working on your land projects?

Good evening from Sweden! What are you studying? I like to sit outside and look and listen to nature around me. The bumblebees go from flower to flower and hear the buzz from them. See the butterflies, see and listen to the birds. Or fishing a little if I can catch some fish for my daughters cat. Even I have started to feel sorry for the fish now. If we were together we will find what we will do for relaxation. Often in the autumn one can see elk here and can see the fox all the year around.
I think you are sleeping now so I will say good morning to you. Have a lovely day and take care

ai_response.generated_message: Good morning from Sweden! I hope Bali has been treating you well since we last spoke. Your days sound so full of life between studies and village projects. I was just watching the bumblebees in my garden again and thought of our conversation about simple pleasures. What's the most beautiful thing you've seen or experienced there this week?
